description: Learned borrowing from Latin vāgīna (“a sheath, scabbard; a covering, sheath, holder”).

nouns.description: vagina (plural vaginas or vaginae or (obsolete) vaginæ)

definitionGroups.group: (anatomy) The passage leading from the opening of the vulva to the cervix of the uterus for copulation and childbirth in female mammals.

entries.meaning: (zootomy) A similar part in some invertebrates.
(botany) A sheathlike structure, such as the leaf of a grass that surrounds a stem.
(colloquial) The vulva, or the vulva and the vaginal passage collectively.
(derogatory, colloquial) A coward; a weakling; a pussy.
